name: reconvict
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to decide officially in a law court that someone is guilty of a crime after they have been convicted (= found guilty of a crime) before, in the past: More than 60% of male short-term prisoners are reconvicted within two years of their release. The conviction of one defendant was reversed, but he was recently re-convicted on other evidence.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was retried without the illegally-obtained evidence, and was reconvicted.Within two years of release, the majority had been re-convicted.The judge re-convicted him for murder, and gave him a life sentence.
